section.heading: Continuing jurisdiction to enforce child-support order.

para.text: A tribunal of the District that has issued a child-support order consistent with the law of the District may serve as an initiating tribunal to request a tribunal of another state to enforce:
The order if the order is the controlling order and has not been modified by a tribunal of another state that assumed jurisdiction pursuant to a law substantially similar to this chapter; or
A money judgment for arrears of support and interest on the order accrued before a determination that an order of another state is the controlling order.
A tribunal of the District having continuing jurisdiction over a support order may act as a responding tribunal to enforce the order.

annoGroup.heading: Section References
annoGroup.annotation: This section is referenced in § 46-302.02 and § 46-302.07.

annoGroup.heading: Effective Dates
annoGroup.annotation: Applicability: Section 3 of D.C. Law 16-137 provided: “This act shall apply as of April 1, 2007.”

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 206 of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act (2001 Act).
